import React from 'react'; import Button from '@material-ui/core/Button'; import {Dialog,Typography,Divider} from '@material-ui/core'; import DialogActions from '@material-ui/core/DialogActions'; import DialogContent from '@material-ui/core/DialogContent'; import DialogContentText from '@material-ui/core/DialogContentText'; import DialogTitle from '@material-ui/core/DialogTitle'; import { MuiThemeProvider, createMuiTheme } from '@material-ui/core/styles'; import Theme from "../../theme/theme-default"; import "../../../assets/appInfo.css" export default function ResponsiveDialog(props) { const getMuiTheme = () => createMuiTheme({ overrides: { MuiDialog:{ paper:{minWidth:"800px", minHeight:"762px"} }, } }); const {title,message, open,handleSubmit, handleClose,actionButton, actionButton2 } = props; debugger return ( {handleClose()}} >

ULCA - Universal Language Contribution APIs

A MeitY initiative.

ULCA is an open-sourced scalable data platform, supporting various types of dataset for Indic languages, along with a user interface for interacting with the datasets.

Dataset

Language datasets

  • Parallel corpus
  • Monolingual corpus
  • ASR / TTS corpus
  • OCR corpus
Open sourced
Model

Language specific tasks

  • Translation
  • Speech recognition
  • Text to speech
  • Optical Character Recognition
Transparent
Benchmark

Open benchmarking

  • Large, diverse task specific benchmarks
  • Research community approved metric system
Inclusive
Why ULCA ?
  • Consolidate & share all the knowledge wealth related to Indic languages with various NLP projects/initiatives.
  • Single stop for working with multiple dataset types.
  • Streamlined data format for each of the dataset types.
  • Collect all possible metadata along with the datasets.
  • Attribute proper credits to every contributor of every record in the dataset.
  • Handle canonical checks and deduplication for each submitted dataset.
  • Provides simple user interface to enable anyone to search & download based on various filters.
  • Open sourced for building a best ecosystem for Indian languages.
  • Quality check of the submitted datasets.
 ); }
